titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 29
CWG14274

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 7

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, January 19th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 29. }
(Extract.)

15. 2d Lieutenant Isaac T. Montgomery, 11th Kentucky Cavalry, is hereby dsicharged the service of the United States, to date February 17th, 1864, on account of physical disability, there being no rolls of his regiment on file since that date, and he having failed to file the necessary Surgeon's Certificates, as required by the regulations of the War Department.

By order of the Sercretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Asisstant Adjutant General.

11 Cavy
Montgomery J. T.
2 Lieut
Order
discharging discharging him from service to date February 17. 1864.
Recd A. G. O. Jany 26. 1863
